etymology.description: Originally 隹 (zhuī, "short-tailed bird") -> written as 唯 (wéi) with 口 (kǒu, "mouth") added -> phonetic 唯 (wéi) + semantic 鳥 (niǎo, "bird") = cry of a bird
etymology.interpretation: The character 鷕 (yǎo) represents a bird's cry by combining the phonetic 唯 (wéi), which suggests the sound, with the semantic 鳥 (niǎo, "bird"), denoting the bird context. This effectively conveys the concept of a bird's cry.
